item.Name: Color Madness Fun Run/Walk
1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA
Thurs.-Sat. 11:30-5:30; Sun. 11:30-4
209-286-1387
www.gallerypetroglyphe.com
Petroglyphe Gallery features original contemporary works of art in oil, acrylic, watercolor, glass, ceramic and jewelry.&nbsp; Also on display, are limited edition bronze sculptures and copper plate etching prints.
The gallery represents North American artists, many from California, who have impressive credentials with works in private, corporate, and public collections.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Gallery
35 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Mon., Wed.,Thurs., Sun., 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat. 10-6
209-267-0228
www.suttercreekgallery.com
An Amador artist coop,our artists produce many works of art that are reflective of Amador County and its beautiful Gold Country. Look for Gold Rush themes in historic buildings and mining ruins, landscapes, vineyards, flora, and fauna.
&nbsp;
Volcano Gallery
16105 Main Street,Volcano, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 10ish-5ish
209-296-3334
www.benkergallery.com
An eclectic mix of contemporary local art. Featuring paintings, ceramic sculpture and pottery by Bob Benker; ceramics by Marilyn Baldwin; jewelry and leather goods by Ellen Record; misc. jewelry, &nbsp;gourds &amp; fun stuff by Delores Weaverling; &nbsp;weaving by Gretchen Johnson &amp; rotating local artists featured monthly.
&nbsp;

item.Name: Reception for Helen Wilkinson
Mardi Gras Party &amp; Cajun Cook-Off
item.Body:
It&rsquo;s Mardi Gras!
Saturday, February 4th 2017, 6:30-10:30pm
&nbsp;
Time to get crazy and have fun for a good cause.
Sample Cajun recipes, dance to live Cajun music, be in the costume contest, and have a great time! Want more?
Play some Poker or Blackjack, get thrown in the &ldquo;Jail House&rdquo;, have your fortune told and other fun stuff. This great event is tons of fun and is a fundraiser for the renovation of the Historic Sutter Creek Grammar School. Please help us to restore this beautiful building by coming to the Mardi Gras Party &amp; Cajun Cook-Off. 100% of the proceeds will go to restoring this building.
Tickets available at The Music Box Company 64 Main Street, The Sutter Creek Visitor Center at 71 A Main Street, and Amador Council of Tourism at 115 Valley View Drive in Sutter Creek.
We CHALLENGE YOU to enter your recipe! It&#39;s FREE to enter. Attached is an application or you can download one at www.suttercreek.org.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Auditorium
18 Main Street
Sutter Creek, CA
916-267-1344
SutterCreek.org

item.Name: Ace Frehley at Jackson Rancheria
Unauthorized Rolling Stones
item.Body:
Saturday
2/4/17
8:00PM
&nbsp;
This was a killer show last time! High energy, costumes, backup singers, lots of fun!
Since their founding in 2001, Rudy Colombini &amp; The Unauthorized Rolling Stones have brought the excitement, energy, and hits of a live Rolling Stones show to stages across the country. In 2014, founder and frontman Colombini expanded the band by adding all-star members from some of the biggest acts in music, including Kevin Russell (Jersey Boys), Matty Pinder, (son of The Moody Blues&rsquo; Mike Pinder), Ronnie Smith, (Tommy Castro Band), and Sandy Griffith, (Celine Dion, Boz Skaggs, Kenny Loggins). The result has been a quantum leap that has left other Stones tributes in the dust.
Rudy Colombini &amp; The Unauthorized Rolling Stones is a must-see, theatrical rock show! The nine-piece ensemble&rsquo;s pedigree can be traced to some of the biggest acts in the business. Their show holds in reverence many legends of the classic rock years, from Zeppelin to Motown to Dylan, while maintaining their Rolling Stones core. And Colombini&rsquo;s staggering, Jaggeresque showmanship now engages in a battle of the sexes with a trio of seductive, bluesy backup vocali

Sutter Creek CA P.O. Box 29 Sacramento CA 95812 (916) 425-0077 info@suttercreektheatre.com

item.Name: Valentine&#039;s Dance at Gold Country Lanes
Kara Grainger on Stage
item.Body:
Saturday, 2/11/17
8:00pm-10:00pm
&nbsp;
With sultry, mesmerizing vocals, engaging songwriting talent, and fiery slide guitar work, Kara Grainger boasts an impressive set of skills. This Australian singer, songwriter and guitarist may evoke comparisons to Bonnie Raitt, but she bears a style all her own, a relentlessly seductive, distinctly modern take on roots, blues and soul music.
Hailing from Sydney (Australia), Kara&rsquo;s music has taken her on an incredible journey throughout the globe. In the US, Kara has performed at numerous Festivals such as The Portland Waterfront Blues Festival and Blues from the Top in Colorado. Kara has also appeared at the Austin City Limits Music Festival.She&rsquo;s opened for many extraordinary acts including Peter Frampton, Buddy Guy, Taj Mahal and Jonny Lang.

item.Name: Boots ’n’ Books Concert
item.Body:
Sunday, February 12, 2017
3:00PM
&nbsp;
Adrian Brannan, aka Adrian Buckaroogirl, will take her listeners deep into the lives and challenges faced by cowboys and ranchers through songs that reflect her experiences growing up on ranches throughout the west when she takes the stage at the Friends of the Amador County Library&rsquo;s 7th Annual Boots &rsquo;n&rsquo; Books Concert.
Adrian was listed by Cowboys and Indians Magazine in its Next West highlights as one of the &ldquo;. . . 20 bright young stars of the Western world . . .&rdquo; She is an exuberant, dynamic, talented, singer/songwriter with an infectious, positive attitude and a powerful voice. Adrian is equally at home in the branding pen roping calves or on stage in front of thousands of fans.
Adrian&rsquo;s second CD, Boots and Pearls, was produced by noted singer/songwriter Tom Russell who said in The Cowboy Way Magazine, &ldquo;I heard the clear potential. I was impressed that she has such a great voice and was so at ease on stage . . . Adrian is the breath of strong fresh air that the cowboy music scene needs. I was honored to have worked with her.&rdquo; The title cut from Boots and Pearls has spawned a nationwide tide of theme weddings from women who identify with Adrian&rsquo;s ability to be a feminine, yet working cowgirl.
Amador County personality Ed Tracey will emcee the event.
A silent auction and raffle will feature prizes including vacation getaways, wine, dinners, theater tickets and gift certificates from a variety of contributors. Refreshments will be served.
Tickets are $20 in advance and $25 at the door (if available).
Tickets are available at: Hein &amp; Company Bookstore, 204 Main Street, Jackson, Mother Lode Music, 11310 Prospect Dr. Ste. 80, Jackson
Online at http://www.brownpapertickets.com. Mail order tickets 209-296-1712.
Pine Grove Community Church
14045 Ponderosa Way
Pine Grove, CA
http://friendsoftheamadorcountylibrary.org/
Jim Powell, 209-296-1712
Boots &rsquo;n&rsquo; Books&rdquo; benefits the Friends of the Amador County Library, a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting the Amador County Library.
This event is sponsored by the Jackson Rancheria Casino Resort.

item.Name: Violinist Corina Stoian On Stage
item.Body:
Saturday, February 18, 2017
3:00 pm - 5:30 pm
&nbsp;
Romanian-born concert violinist Corina Stoian celebrates the 10th anniversary of her American debut in this recreation of her historic recital of February 2006 at the Sutter Creek Theatre. Works on the program include the great &ldquo;Kreutzer&rdquo; Sonata of Beethoven, Sonata No. 3 in C minor of Grieg, Danse Macabre of Saint Sa&euml;ns and selections of George Gershwin for violin and piano.&nbsp; With Ron Brickman, piano.&nbsp; A reception will follow.
Admission charged
Sutter Creek Theatre
33 Main Street
Sutter Creek, CA
&nbsp;
Motherlode Friends of Music
P.O. Box 1362
Jackson, California 95642
209-293-4227, Ron Brickman

item.Name: Sutter Creek Theatre
item.Body:
North Carolina&#39;s Nu-Blu brings its lively and entertaining version of Americana bluegrass music to audiences across the nation. Their fusion sound acknowledges the traditional institutions that have shaped it, yet is innovative and daring enough to bring a fresh sparkle
to contemporary acoustic music. Founded by husband and wife team Carolyn and Daniel Routh, Nu-Blu&#39;s influences range from pioneers like Earl Scruggs, Jimmy Martin and Lester Flatt to 80&#39;s rock to modern contemporary sounds such as Alison Krauss &amp; Union&hellip;

item.Name: Nu-Blu – Newgrass
item.Body:
February 18, 2017
8:00 pm - 10:00 pm $19 - $21
&nbsp;
North Carolina&rsquo;s Nu-Blu brings its lively and entertaining version of Americana bluegrass music to audiences across the nation. Their fusion sound acknowledges the traditional institutions that have shaped it, yet is innovative and daring enough to bring a fresh sparkle to contemporary acoustic music. Founded by husband and wife team Carolyn and Daniel Routh, Nu-Blu&rsquo;s influences range from pioneers like Earl Scruggs, Jimmy Martin and Lester Flatt to 80&rsquo;s rock to modern contemporary sounds such as Alison Krauss &amp; Union Station.
Multiple top 10 songs on bluegrass charts, featured performers in 2014 at CMA, NAMM, MerleFest, and Folk Alliance.
&ldquo;If you&rsquo;re serious about your bluegrass, country, and Americana, you can&rsquo;t do without!&rdquo; Folk &amp; Acoustic Music Exchange
&ldquo;Nu-Blu keeps the traditional fires burning while stirring the flames with a youthful energy that create a new form and sound that expands beyond genres&rdquo; Alternate Root Magazine
Sutter Creek Theatre
44 Main St.
Sutter Creek CA P.O. Box 29 Sacramento CA 95812 (916) 425-0077 info@suttercreektheatre.com

item.Body:
Saturday, 2/25/17
8:00pm-10:00pm
&nbsp;
This band is a reincarnation of the the group formerly known as Houston Jones. Still performing high octane Americana flair, with some new faces on lead and pedal steel guitar, they perform popular Houston Jones hits, as well as originals.
Travis Jones covers acoustic and electric guitar, lead and background vocals and percussion. Henry Salvia is on keyboards, lead and background vocals &amp; percussion. item.Name: Winter Wine Luncheon
A Night in Burgundy
item.Body:
Thursday
December 22, 2016 6:00 p.m.
&nbsp;
When thinking of France, the first images that may come to mind are the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, and the Arc de Triomphe. All are absolutely stunning in their own right, but there are other treasures in France to fall in love with -- the wine and cuisine of Burgundy!
What makes this one-of-a-kind region so special? The wine and food are completely influenced by unique terroir, culture, landscape, and history. Join us at Taste Restaurant and Wine bar for a night of culinary exploration of Burgundy, one of the most celebrated wine regions in the world.
A Night in Burgundy Menu
Amuse Bouche Escargots a la Bourguignon En Cro&ucirc;t&eacute; garlic herb butter 2015 Simonett Febvre Chablis, Burgundy
Salade Fris&eacute;e aux Lardon poached farm egg, pork belly, red wine vinaigrette 2016 Henry Fessy Beaujolais Nouveau, Burgundy
Boeuf Bourguignon braised short rib, foraged mushroom,carrot, cipollini onion 2014 Louis Latour Domaine de Valmoissine, Burgundy
Berthaut Epoissess AOC Cheese preserved plum chutney, grilled baguette
Tarte Tatin local apple, gastrique, gelato Simonnet Febvre Cremant NV, Burgundy
sixty-five per person non-inclusive
call (209) 245-3463 to reserve your seat
&nbsp;
Taste
9402 Main Street Plymouth, California
info@RestaurantTaste.com
restauranttaste.com (209) 245-3463
&nbsp;
Make it a one night get away and stay at Rest, a boutique hotel our sister property right next door to Taste.
www.hotelrest.net

item.Name: Kennedy Mine Tours
Behind the Cellar Door
1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA
Thurs.-Sat. 11:30-5:30; Sun. 11:30-4
209-286-1387
www.gallerypetroglyphe.com
Petroglyphe Gallery features original contemporary works of art in oil, acrylic, watercolor, glass, ceramic and jewelry.&nbsp; Also on display, are limited edition bronze sculptures and copper plate etching prints.
The gallery represents North American artists, many from California, who have impressive credentials with works in private, corporate, and public collections.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Gallery
35 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Mon., Wed.,Thurs., Sun., 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat. 10-6
209-267-0228
www.suttercreekgallery.com
An Amador artist coop,our artists produce many works of art that are reflective of Amador County and its beautiful Gold Country. Look for Gold Rush themes in historic buildings and mining ruins, landscapes, vineyards, flora, and fauna.
&nbsp;
Volcano Gallery
16105 Main Street,Volcano, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 10ish-5ish
209-296-3334
www.benkergallery.com
An eclectic mix of contemporary local art. Featuring paintings, ceramic sculpture and pottery by Bob Benker; ceramics by Marilyn Baldwin; jewelry and leather goods by Ellen Record; misc. jewelry, &nbsp;gourds &amp; fun stuff by Delores Weaverling; &nbsp;weaving by Gretchen Johnson &amp; rotating local artists featured monthly.
&nbsp;
Art Trek businesses with local art on their walls for viewing:

74 Main Street
Sutter Creek, CA (209)267-0440
facebook.com/backroadscoffeehouse
&nbsp;

Sutter Creek, CA (209)267-4411

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

item.Name: Kennedy Mine Tours
Behind the Cellar Door
Motorcar Rail Ride
item.Body:
Second Saturdays
March through June
9:00 am to 4:00 pm
&nbsp;
Motorcar Rail Rides take you along the historic Amador Central Railroad, a three-mile round trip which takes a little over an hour. Ride on a motorcar from Ione to Sunny Brook and back through the beautiful Amador County hills.
First ride leaves at 9:00 am and last ride leaves at 2:30 pm.
First come first served, no advance tickets will be sold.&nbsp;
Motorcar rides are $20.00 round trip; children under 10, only $10. NO open toed shoes or sandals, and riders must be a minimum of 5 years old.&nbsp;
If you are a motorcar operator\owner and are NARCOA licensed and insured and would like to participate in giving rides, contact name is below.
Rail crossing at Highway 104, between Highway 88 and Highway 124. Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
Grant Vogel, 209-221-5418, grant@amadorcentral.com AmadorCentral.com/Events

item.Name: Come OUT to Amador
item.Body:
Come OUT to Amador... the county&#39;s first food and wine weekend for the LGBT community taking place March 24-26, 2017. Come OUT to Amador is an LGBT weekend of curated food, wine and fun experiences in the Sierra Nevada foothills. Participants will experience intimate sessions with renowned wine makers, grape growers, acclaimed chefs, farmers and so much more, all with the backdrop of beautiful Amador County.&nbsp;
Tickets include:
- Friday evening reception/light tapas style dinner with wine pairings
- Friday evening interactive entertainment experience, with wine, of course
- Either an all day excursion or two smaller intimate experiences focused around food, wine, the outdoors and history. All experiences include specially crafted catered lunches, afternoon snacks, and... wine!
- Beer vs Wine Dinner on Saturday night, catered by James Beard recognized Restaurant Taste
- Light brunch on Sunday
- Sunday afternoon activities on your own
- Transportation to/from all events and experiences from host hotels (park your car on Friday evening and don&#39;t touch it again until Sunday afternoon).
- All host hotels include breakfast on Saturday and Sunday for Come OUT guests.&nbsp;
All information and ticket purchases can be found at Come Out to Amador Tickets and questions can be sent to comeouttoamador@gmail.com.
&nbsp;

item.Name: Party Pardee Century Ride
item.Body:
1st Saturday in April
&nbsp;
Join the fun at the Party Pardee Century presented by Sacramento Bike Hikers
Come and enjoy this early season metric century in the rolling foothills of Amador and Calaveras counties near the gold rush town of Ione. You&#39;ll find well stocked rest stops and friendly volunteers to greet and refuel you along your tour. At the end of the ride you&#39;ll enjoy a delicious after-ride meal and live music.
Ride check-in: Saturday between 7:00a.m and 9:30a.m (No check-ins on Friday)
Course start times: 100k Route: 7:30a.m. until 9:30a.m. and 50k Route: 8:30a.m. until 9:30a.m.
The Post Ride Meal will be served from 11a.m. until 3:30p.m
The Party Pardee starts and ends at Howard Park in Ione. Located on Hwy 124 approximately 1 mile south of the intersection of Hwy 124 and Hwy 104 in Ione.
&nbsp;
Howard Park
600 S Church St.
Ione, CA

item.Name: Kennedy Mine Tours
Preston Castle Historical Tours
item.Body:
&nbsp;Tours
Saturdays&nbsp; April 1st, 2017 thru&nbsp; August , 2017&nbsp; Except July 29th August 5th and 26th 2017
10am to 1pm
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
Come to Ione and enjoy an informative historical tour of the magnificent Preston Castle and surrounding grounds.&nbsp; The strikingly beautiful Romanesque style Preston Castle, on a hill in Ione, was actually the administration building for the Preston School of Industry, the first major attempt in California at rehabilitating, instead of just imprisoning, young offenders.&nbsp; Opened in 1894, the Preston School of Industry became a leader in the juvenile prison reform movement by giving convicted boys a real chance at life by educating them not only in academics, but in all of the useful trades of the time.&nbsp; Closed in 1960, when the Preston Youth Authority moved into a new administration building down the hill, the Preston Castle was left to deteriorate due to weather, vandalism, and general neglect.&nbsp; It now serves as a vacant, but vitally important landmark for Ione, Amador County, and the Mother lode.&nbsp; It is a California State Historic Landmark and is on the National Register of Historic Places.
Also available is a Virtual Tour for our mobility-restricted guests which will take place on the accessible ground floor (basement) of the Castle.
Guided tours - $15, age 12 and under $12
Self-Guided and Virtual tours - $10, 12 and under $5
All tours for under 5 years, free
&nbsp;
Preston Castle
900 Palm Dr.&nbsp;(end of)
Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
(209)256-3623
info@prestoncastle.com
www.prestoncastle.com
&nbsp;

item.Name: 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA
Thurs.-Sat. 11:30-5:30; Sun. 11:30-4
209-286-1387
www.gallerypetroglyphe.com
Petroglyphe Gallery features original contemporary works of art in oil, acrylic, watercolor, glass, ceramic and jewelry.&nbsp; Also on display, are limited edition bronze sculptures and copper plate etching prints.
The gallery represents North American artists, many from California, who have impressive credentials with works in private, corporate, and public collections.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Gallery
35 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Mon., Wed.,Thurs., Sun., 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat. 10-6
209-267-0228
www.suttercreekgallery.com
An Amador artist coop,our artists produce many works of art that are reflective of Amador County and its beautiful Gold Country. Look for Gold Rush themes in historic buildings and mining ruins, landscapes, vineyards, flora, and fauna.
&nbsp;
Volcano Gallery
16105 Main Street,Volcano, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 10ish-5ish
209-296-3334
www.benkergallery.com
An eclectic mix of contemporary local art. Featuring paintings, ceramic sculpture and pottery by Bob Benker; ceramics by Marilyn Baldwin; jewelry and leather goods by Ellen Record; misc. jewelry, &nbsp;gourds &amp; fun stuff by Delores Weaverling; &nbsp;weaving by Gretchen Johnson &amp; rotating local artists featured monthly.
&nbsp;
Art Trek businesses with local art on their walls for viewing:
Sina&#39;s Back Roads Coffee House
74 Main Street
Sutter Creek, CA (209)267-0440
facebook.com/backroadscoffeehouse
&nbsp;
Choc-O-Latte 46 Main Street
Sutter Creek, CA (209)267-4411
Facebook.com/ChoOLatte
&nbsp;
Rosebuds Cafe
26 Main Street Jackson, CA (209)257-0227
Facebook.com/RosebudsCafe
&nbsp;
Sierra Ridge Tasting Room 54 Main Street Sutter Creek, CA (209)267-1316
SierraRidgeWinery.com
&nbsp;
Union Inn and Pub 21375 Consolation Street Volcano, CA (209)296-7711
volcanounion.com
&nbsp;
Uphill Vineyards
18590 Highway 49
Plymouth, CA
209-245-6600 or(707) 718-1121
www.uphillvineyards.com/
&nbsp;
Valley View Interiors 48 Main Street Sutter Creek (209)267-5515
valleyviewinteriors.com
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
Amador County Arts Council
11-A Randolph Street&nbsp;
PO BOX 206
Sutter Creek, Ca 95685
209 267 9038
info@AmadorArts.org
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Amador County Arts Council &ndash; Supporting, promoting and encouraging the Arts in our schools and community for more than 30 years.

item.Name: Amador Flower Farm Spring Fling
item.Body:
1st Saturday &amp; Sunday
9:00am-4:00pm
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
A celebration of the beginning of spring!
&nbsp;
The nursery will be filled with vegetable starter plants- the largest selection in all of Amador County!
Visit with Amador County artists and craftsmen! Food will be available or you can pack your own picnic.
Free tram rides all day (weather permitting).
This event will take place rain or shine.
Free admission, free parking!
Sorry, no pets are allowed at the farm.

Plymouth, CA&nbsp; 95669

item.Name: Wildflowers and Wine
item.Body:
Sunday, April 2nd&nbsp;
11am to 4pm
&nbsp;
Stroll through charming Sutter Creek and enjoy a beautiful spring day and wines from eight wineries, gourmet food bites, music, art, and lots of wildflowers.
All of our tasting rooms are&nbsp;within walking distance&nbsp;in the historic town of Sutter Creek. Sip wine, shop and take leisurely strolls through one of the gold rush era&#39;s&nbsp;most charming&nbsp;towns.
We are a collaboration of wine tasting rooms all located in the historic&nbsp;town of Sutter Creek, CA. We are about supporting local businesses and promoting the&nbsp;authenticity of&nbsp;what Amador County is best known for- GREAT wine, rich history and natural landscapes.
Purchase tickets: www.wineon49.com/#!blank/x45lj
&nbsp;
Main Street &amp; Hanford Street
Sutter Creek, CA 95685
enjoywine@wineon49.com
http://www.wineon49.com/

item.Name: Pino Noir Tasting
Motorcar Rail Ride
item.Body:
Second Saturdays
March through June
9:00 am to 4:00 pm
&nbsp;
Motorcar Rail Rides take you along the historic Amador Central Railroad, a three-mile round trip which takes a little over an hour. Ride on a motorcar from Ione to Sunny Brook and back through the beautiful Amador County hills.
First ride leaves at 9:00 am and last ride leaves at 2:30 pm.
First come first served, no advance tickets will be sold.&nbsp;
Motorcar rides are $20.00 round trip; children under 10, only $10. NO open toed shoes or sandals, and riders must be a minimum of 5 years old.&nbsp;
If you are a motorcar operator\owner and are NARCOA licensed and insured and would like to participate in giving rides, contact name is below.
Rail crossing at Highway 104, between Highway 88 and Highway 124. Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
Grant Vogel, 209-221-5418, grant@amadorcentral.com AmadorCentral.com/Events

item.Name: Get Vertical Weekend
Chamber Music Concert
item.Body:
Sunday, April 9, 2017
3:00 pm - 5:30
&nbsp;
Motherlode Friends of Music features the String Quintet in G minor, K 516, of W. A. Mozart, one of the composer&rsquo;s finest chamber works, as performed by five of the Sacramento area&rsquo;s top string players. The second half features our Distinguished Young Artist of the Year, bass-trombonist Rudi Hoehn, principal with the Santa Barbara Symphony, performing &ldquo;New Orleans&rdquo; of Eugene Bozza and other works. Our special guest is tenor trombonist Craig Beattie, Juilliard-trained and now a freelance musician in the Houston area.
The free concert will be held at:
Pine Grove Community Church
14045 Ponderosa Way
Pine Grove, CA
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
Motherlode Friends of Music
P.O. Box 1362
Jackson, California 95642
209-293-4227, Ron Brickman
http://www.mlfm.org/contact/
http://www.mlfm.org/

item.Name: Sierra Century Ride
item.Body:
Saturday, April 15th,
Check-In: 6-9am
Start Time:&nbsp;7am
&nbsp;
The Sacramento Wheelmen&#39;s Sierra Century Slug Gulch invites you to choose an adventure from among 5 different routes through the beautiful rolling oak woodland and pine forests of Amador and El Dorado Counties, including the wine regions of Fair Play and Shenandoah Valley and historic Gold Rush towns of Ione, Sutter Creek, Volcano, Fiddletown, Mt. Aukum and Slug Gulch. Some of these routes are adventures because this largely undeveloped county is highly scenic and uniquely historic, the roads are in good condition with little and often no traffic, and the available routes have a wide variety of terrain. All of the routes have significant climbing.&nbsp; If you are looking for routes that are flat or mostly flat, this event is not for you. All routes begin and end at the Amador County Fairgrounds.
&nbsp;
All routes are fully supported by rest and water stops, SAG vehicles with HAM radio communication, bicycle mechanics, flaggers, law enforcement personnel and a large corps of volunteers
To register: www.sacwheelmen.org/page-1856744&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; LIMITED TO 1500 RIDERS
&nbsp;
Sacramento Wheelmen
P.O. Box 15739
Sacramento, CA 95852
www.sacwheelmen.org/page-1856741
Sierra Century Director Mike Kersten mikejkersten@yahoo.com
For Registration Information:
michaelgoble@yahoo.com
&nbsp;
Amador County Fairgrounds
18621 Sherwood St.
Plymouth, CA &nbsp;95669
209-245-6921
&nbsp;

Spring Book Sale
item.Body:
Friday, April 21 from 4:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m., FACL Members only. Non-members may join at the sale
Saturday, April 22 from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Open to the general public Sunday, April 23 from 11:00 a.m. tp 3:00 p.m., Open to the general public and everything on sale at half price (Sunday only)
&nbsp;
Our Spring Book Sales enable us to help the library as they need money for subscriptions, new computers, systems for DVD storage, children&#39;s story time and the summer reading program, Little Libraries, adding to the general collection and lots more. We are fortunate to live in a community with so many people who are generous with their donations and time. The book sale takes five days to assemble, host and disassemble, but it has become a labor of love. It is so wonderful to work with all of the enthusiastic, competent volunteers.
&nbsp;
American Legion Hall
12134 Airport Road
Sutter Creek, CA
209-296-2771
friendsoftheamadorcountylibrary.org/booksales.php

item.Name: BOWLING FOR A CURE!
Denim Day Balloon Release
Days of 49
item.Body:
April 27th to April30th
2017
&nbsp;
The colorful Kit Carson Mountain Men will rendezvous for their living history Days of 49 Wagon Train re-enactment through the Gold Country, where everyone is invited to visit with horse-men and women at stops and encampments along the way. All public events are free.
&nbsp;
An authentic wagon train of 15 horse-drawn covered wagons will start their journey from the encampment at Amador County Fairgrounds through Plymouth, Drytown, Amador City and Sutter Creek, to Jackson for a celebration of&nbsp;California&rsquo;s pioneer heritage. &nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The public is invited to join the wagon train nightly for barbecue dinners and casual entertainment, such as singing by the campfire.
&nbsp;
The Wagon Train 4-day adventure begins at the Amador County Fairgrounds in Plymouth and ends on historic Main Street Jackson.
&nbsp;

Thursday
9:00am

4:00pm-8:00pm

5K and Duckling Dash
Antique Truck Show &amp; BBQ
item.Body:
A nnually
Last Saturday in April
8am - 6pm
&nbsp;
The&nbsp; American Truck Historical Society Truck show (Central California Chapter) will be showing antique trucks from all over California and out of state. Great trucks, great food, great friends! What more could you ask for?
Along with the wide variety of trucks, this year&#39;s show will feature live operation of the steam powered sawmill on the Amador County Fairgrounds. The Amador Sawmill is one of the last operational steam powered sawmills in California.
Dinner starts at 4pm. We sell out. Place your order early
To participate in the show print and complete the Registration Form and send form and check to:
Emogene Thomas 321 Paloma Court Martinez,CA 94553 (925)228-5483

item.Name: Kennedy Mine Tours
Preston Castle Historical Tours
item.Body:
Schedule for&nbsp; public tours
Every Saturday and Sunday,&nbsp; April 1, 2017 through September 10, 2017
Tours start at 10 am. Last guided tour starts 1:00pm
&nbsp;
Come to Ione and enjoy an informative historical tour of the magnificent Preston Castle and surrounding grounds.&nbsp; The strikingly beautiful Romanesque style Preston Castle, on a hill in Ione, was actually the administration building for the Preston School of Industry, the first major attempt in California at rehabilitating, instead of just imprisoning, young offenders.&nbsp; Opened in 1894, the Preston School of Industry became a leader in the juvenile prison reform movement by giving convicted boys a real chance at life by educating them not only in academics, but in all of the useful trades of the time.&nbsp; Closed in 1960, when the Preston Youth Authority moved into a new administration building down the hill, the Preston Castle was left to deteriorate due to weather, vandalism, and general neglect.&nbsp; It now serves as a vacant, but vitally important landmark for Ione, Amador County, and the Motherlode.&nbsp; It is a California State Historic Landmark and is on the National Register of Historic Places.
Also available is a Virtual Tour for our mobility-restricted guests which will take place on the accessible ground floor (basement) of the Castle.
Guided tours - $15, age 12 and under $12
Virtual tours - $10, 12 and under $5
All tours for under 5 years, free
&nbsp;
Preston Castle
900 Palm Dr.&nbsp;(end of)
Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
(209)256-3623
info@prestoncastle.com
www.prestoncastle.com
&nbsp;

item.Name: Zins on Horizon
Chamber Music Concert
item.Body:
Sunday, April 30, 2017
3:00 pm - 5:30
&nbsp;
Motherlode Friends of music presents our final concert of the season features violinist Marie Flexer and cellist Stephanie Chiao, with Ron Brickman at the piano. The program includes the Sonata for violin and cello of Maurice Ravel, the Piano Trio in Eb, Hob. V. 29 of Joseph Haydn, Rachmaninoff&rsquo;s Elegiac Trio in G minor, and the wild and crazy Variations on &ldquo;Tico-Tico&rdquo; by Lucio Bruno-Videla.&nbsp; Soprano Alexis Magar&ograve; returns to sing three ravishing songs of Rachmaninoff and the sublime &ldquo;Dream With Me&rdquo; of Leonard Bernstein with piano and cello obbligato. The&nbsp; concert is free and will be at:
Pine Grove Community Church
14045 Ponderosa Way
Pine Grove, CA
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
Motherlode Friends of Music
P.O. Box 1362
Jackson, California 95642
209-293-4227, Ron Brickman

item.Name: Plymouth Flea Market
Gem &amp; Craft Fair
Kennedy Mine Tours
&quot;Springtime in the Foothills&quot; Annual Flower Show
Vino en Mayo
1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA
Thurs.-Sat. 11:30-5:30; Sun. 11:30-4
209-286-1387
www.gallerypetroglyphe.com
Petroglyphe Gallery features original contemporary works of art in oil, acrylic, watercolor, glass, ceramic and jewelry.&nbsp; Also on display, are limited edition bronze sculptures and copper plate etching prints.
The gallery represents North American artists, many from California, who have impressive credentials with works in private, corporate, and public collections.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Gallery
35 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Mon., Wed.,Thurs., Sun., 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat. 10-6
209-267-0228
www.suttercreekgallery.com
An Amador artist coop,our artists produce many works of art that are reflective of Amador County and its beautiful Gold Country. Look for Gold Rush themes in historic buildings and mining ruins, landscapes, vineyards, flora, and fauna.
&nbsp;
Volcano Gallery
16105 Main Street,Volcano, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 10ish-5ish
209-296-3334
www.benkergallery.com
An eclectic mix of contemporary local art. Featuring paintings, ceramic sculpture and pottery by Bob Benker; ceramics by Marilyn Baldwin; jewelry and leather goods by Ellen Record; misc. jewelry, &nbsp;gourds &amp; fun stuff by Delores Weaverling; &nbsp;weaving by Gretchen Johnson &amp; rotating local artists featured monthly.

item.Name: Ione Homecoming
item.Body:
This annual celebration has been held during the 2nd weekend of May almost every year since that first Centennial celebration in 1876. The Ione Picnic Association coordinates this historic event. Celebrations include a wide variety of activities for all ages!
Friday, 6pm - 9pm:
Rib Cook-Off Live Music Carnival Vendors Dance Performance Fireworks
Saturday, 7:30am - 11pm:
Pancake Breakfast Bedbug Challenge 10k Run/5KWalk Sheep Dog Trials Homecoming Parade Preston Castle Tours Vendors Carnival Soap Box Derby Cow/Calf Chip Bingo Petting Zoo Horseshoe Tournament Petting Zoo Chili Cook-Off Salsa Contest Live Music Pet Contest Bingo Mutton Bustin&#39; Rancher&#39;s Day&nbsp;Rodeo Kid&#39;s Airplane Candy Drop Ione H.S. item.Name: Art Garfunkel in Concert
Motorcar Rail Ride
item.Body:
Second Saturdays
March through June
9:00 am to 4:00 pm
&nbsp;
Motorcar Rail Rides take you along the historic Amador Central Railroad, a three-mile round trip which takes a little over an hour. Ride on a motorcar from Ione to Sunny Brook and back through the beautiful Amador County hills.
First ride leaves at 9:00 am and last ride leaves at 2:30 pm.
First come first served, no advance tickets will be sold.&nbsp;
Motorcar rides are $20.00 round trip; children under 10, only $10. NO open toed shoes or sandals, and riders must be a minimum of 5 years old.&nbsp;
If you are a motorcar operator\owner and are NARCOA licensed and insured and would like to participate in giving rides, contact name is below.
Rail crossing at Highway 104, between Highway 88 and Highway 124. Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
Grant Vogel, 209-221-5418, grant@amadorcentral.com AmadorCentral.com/Events

Wine lovers are invited to enjoy A Divine Affair in the Jackson Rancheria&#39;s Grand Oak Ballroom and on the Garden Terrace.&nbsp; This event features award winning Amador County wine selections, divine chocolate, specialty food pairings, flavorful olive oil and cigar tastings. Enjoy tasting and experiencing all of Amador County&rsquo;s most enriching flavors at A Divine Affair. Tickets include Tickets include complimentary wine glass and tray, wine tasting, food and entertainment. Wine purchases may be ordered, but must be shipped by or picked up at the winery.
Tickets for A Divine Affair are $25 in advance and $30 at the door. Tickets for Elite and VIP Dreamcatcher&rsquo;s Club&reg; members are only $10 and $10 for designated drivers. They can be purchased at the Casino Cashier&rsquo;s Cage or JacksonCasino.com.

item.Name: Old-Timers&#039; Music Jam
Mother Lode Harvest Open House
item.Body:
Sunday
May 21, 2017
12pm - 3pm
&nbsp;
Mother Lode Harvest, a local foods and farm products association, is having its spring quarter open house at the farm of one of its producer members. Mother Lode Harvest members, as well as local residents who would like to learn about sustainable agriculture and accessing local food, are invited to tour the farm and enjoy demonstrations, information, and light refreshments. Other participating growers will also be on hand to answer questions about sustainable farming.
The event will take place at Casa de la Pradera, the farm of Alice Kaiser, 20161 American Flat Road in Fiddletown. Parking for the event is at the old Schoolhouse across the road from the cemetery and the farm; attendees should park at the Schoolhouse and walk the short distance to the farm.
A&nbsp; suggested donation per adult is requested to support the work of Mother Lode Harvest, which is a nonprofit association.
Casa de la Pradera, farm of Alice Kaiser
20161 American Flat Road
Fiddletown, CA
209-245-6042

item.Name: Project Thank You&#039;s Family Fun Fair
AmadorArts Student Arts Showcase
item.Body:
Thursday, May 25
4-7 pm
Friday, May 26, 2017
3 to 5pm
&nbsp;
A free community event with complimentary refreshments will be happening.It&rsquo;s the annual AmadorArts Student Arts Showcase, the time to view a wildly creative cross-section of art created by local elementary school students.&nbsp;
On Thursday, the showcase will coincide with the May AmadorArts Arts Networking Mixer. The Heart and Soul Studio at 21 Badger Street in Sutter Creek will be the place, and AmadorArts will be the hosts and organizers of the Student Arts Showcase.
Each year AmadorArts brings in-depth standards-based instruction by&nbsp;professional artists into all of our local elementary schools. In the 2015-2016 school year, a total of 1,450 students will have participated in arts classes&nbsp;facilitated by the non-profit organization. Classes included: 1st grade Color Wheel, 2nd grade Doodle Art, 3rd grade Matisse-inspired Paper Collage, 4th grade Watercolor Technique and 5th grade Chalk Pastel.&nbsp;
Arts education not only enhances students&#39; understanding of the world around them, but it also gives them a sense of emotional satisfaction when they are involved in making art. They have control over the materials they use, making decisions about form, color, etc. &nbsp;And, it brings joy.
So, come see the students&rsquo; art that is the result of these programs. Be amazed by our youth&rsquo;s creativity!&nbsp; The Chair of the California Arts Council confirms the idea: &ldquo;It is always exciting to see what creative minds attempt to do when being guided by professional working artists.&rdquo;
Event Location:
Heart and Soul Studio
21 Badger St.
Sutter Creek
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
AmadorArts
Amador County Arts Council
11A Randolph Street&nbsp;
PO BOX 206
Sutter Creek, Ca 95685
209 267 9038
amadorarts@gmail.com
www.amadorarts.org

item.Name: Trash To Treasures
Ione Rail Fair &amp; Vintage Motor Fest
item.Body:
Memorial Day Weekend Saturday &amp; Sunday 8am - 6pm
Each year over Memorial Day weekend the Rail Fair which features rides on the rails, many exhibits including model railroads, antique cars, trucks, and gas engines as well as vendors and other activities.
Ride on a motorcar from Ione to Sunny Brook and back through the beautiful Amador County hills.
Runs on Saturday, all day until 3:30 p.m. and on Sunday morning until noon.
Tickets go on sale at 8:00 a.m. with the first run scheduled to depart at 9:00 a.m. on Saturday and Sunday at Ione Jr. High school in front of the auditorium.
Due to the popularity of these motorcar rides it will once again be first come first served, no advance tickets will be sold.&nbsp;
Motorcar rides are $20.00 round trip.&nbsp; NO open toed shoes or sandals, and riders must be a minimum of 5 years old.&nbsp;
If you are a motorcar operator\owner and are NARCOA licensed and insured&nbsp; and would like to participate in giving rides, Contact name is below.
Ione Jr. High School S. Mill Street (end of) Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
Grant Vogel, 209-221-5418, grant@amadorcentral.com
AmadorCentral.com/Events

item.Name: String Bean Alley 5K Fun Run
Kennedy Mine Tours
1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA
Thurs.-Sat. 11:30-5:30; Sun. 11:30-4
209-286-1387
www.gallerypetroglyphe.com
Petroglyphe Gallery features original contemporary works of art in oil, acrylic, watercolor, glass, ceramic and jewelry.&nbsp; Also on display, are limited edition bronze sculptures and copper plate etching prints.
The gallery represents North American artists, many from California, who have impressive credentials with works in private, corporate, and public collections.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Gallery
35 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Mon., Wed.,Thurs., Sun., 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat. 10-6
209-267-0228
www.suttercreekgallery.com
An Amador artist coop,our artists produce many works of art that are reflective of Amador County and its beautiful Gold Country. Look for Gold Rush themes in historic buildings and mining ruins, landscapes, vineyards, flora, and fauna.
&nbsp;
Volcano Gallery
16105 Main Street,Volcano, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 10ish-5ish
209-296-3334
www.benkergallery.com
An eclectic mix of contemporary local art. Featuring paintings, ceramic sculpture and pottery by Bob Benker; ceramics by Marilyn Baldwin; jewelry and leather goods by Ellen Record; misc. jewelry, &nbsp;gourds &amp; fun stuff by Delores Weaverling; &nbsp;weaving by Gretchen Johnson &amp; rotating local artists featured monthly.

item.Body:
2017
Sunday, June 4, Noon to 4 pm,

Plan B for Barbera
On Photographer&rsquo;s Day you can roam the castle on a self-guided tour. Visitors are allowed four hours to explore the non-restricted areas of the castle. This gives you the time you need to set up shots without rushing to keep up the pace of our normal informative tours.&nbsp;
Come to one, two, or all three times &ndash; you will never run out of cool shots.&nbsp; Note the dates are on Sunday, and the September date includes twilight/evening light. $40 per person.&nbsp;
Limited to 100 tickets each day. Buy your tickets early as these always sell out. Tickets available on our website, www.prestoncastle.com

Motorcar Rail Rides take you along the historic Amador Central Railroad, a three-mile round trip which takes a little over an hour. Ride on a motorcar from Ione to Sunny Brook and back through the beautiful Amador County hills.
First ride leaves at 9:00 am and last ride leaves at 2:30 pm.
First come first served, no advance tickets will be sold.&nbsp;
Motorcar rides are $20.00 round trip; children under 10, only $10. NO open toed shoes or sandals, and riders must be a minimum of 5 years old.&nbsp;

item.Name: Mother Lode Highland Games &amp; Gathering
item.Body:
Annually
Father&#39;s Day Weekend
Saturday &amp; Sunday
&nbsp;
June 10-11, 2017
Gates open at 9:00am
&nbsp;
Scotland is coming to Amador County with the inaugural Mother Lode Highland Games and Gathering. This two-day event is great for the whole family, from the young to the young at heart.
&nbsp;
The Highland Games will have events such as caber tossing (throwing what looks like a wooden telephone pole one end over the other), putting the stone (similar to shot put but with an irregular-shaped, 16-pound stone), weight for distance (a 56 pound weight thrown with one hand while keeping the feet within a very small area) and tossing the sheaf (picking up a bundle of straw with a pitchfork and tossing it over a bar). Carl McDanel, Chief of the Mother Lode Scots, says the games are fashioned after those believed to have taken place during ancient times to help chieftains in the highlands of Scotland find the strongest men for their armies. The Games are played by competitive men and women from around the nation and from other countries.
If you are wanting to find your roots you can visit the Clan Village where many clans will be available to assist in that search. They will have books and information on the various clans.
For the kids there will be a Children&#39;s Glen with their own games, such as potato sack races, tug-of-war contests, they can even throw a mini caber. A children&#39;s tent will have crafts for the kids and other fun things to do throughout the day.
During this weekend event one can hear Scottish music, bagpipes and entertainment.
For the animal lovers there will be Miniature Highland Cattle (or Coos as they&#39;re called in Scotland), Sheep Dog Demonstrations along with other animal displays and demonstrations. In the dog arena there will be deer hounds, border collies, along with several other breeds.
Along with the competitive games and music, animals, and children&#39;s activities there will also be a classic car show.
For those who have never tried Scottish foods come on out. In our food court there will be fish and chips, pasties, meat pies and of course haggis (the Americanized version which is a &ldquo;sausage of meat and oats along with some spices). The Games will have a number of Scottish food vendors along with other foods as well.
And for those of you who like to shop you can visit the Village Marketplace where you will find 30 plus craft vendors, kilt makers/dealers, Scottish and Irish candies along with English Toffee, glassware, clothing, imports and much, much more.
Since Amador County is rich in viticulture the Games will offer wine seminars throughout the weekend. These wine tasting seminars will provide you with a greater understanding of the Shenandoah Valley and Fiddletown Appellations, characteristics of various varietals, wine styles along with much more.
Scotland with it&#39;s long history in the distillation of Scotch (or malt as its called in Scotland) will offer whisky tasting seminars. These seminars will provide you with a greater understanding of the history of whisky, it&#39;s distillation process and the various characteristics of whisky varieties.
Last, but not least, will be the Living History Village where you may run into anyone from Mary Queen of Scot to weavers and craftsmen to Mountain Men. In the Living History Village one can also pan for gold, view the ore crusher and watch lumber being cut on the Gold Rush Era Sawmill.
Amador County Fairgrounds
18621 Sherwood St.
Plymouth CA&nbsp; 95669
Carl McDanel, (209) 245-5400
&nbsp;
www.TheMotherLodeGames.com
&nbsp;
Facebook.com/TheMotherLodeHighlandGames
&nbsp;

item.Name: Kennedy Mine Tours
Celebrate the Grape with the Godfather of Barbera
Vino Noceto Farm to Glass Tour
Preston Castle Self Guided Tours
item.Body:
Schedule for&nbsp; Self Guided tours, June&nbsp; 12, 2017 July 11th&nbsp; 2017 August 15th 2017
Tours start at 10 am. Last Self guided tour starts 1:00pm
&nbsp;
Come to Ione and enjoy an informative historical tour of the magnificent Preston Castle and surrounding grounds.&nbsp; The strikingly beautiful Romanesque style Preston Castle, on a hill in Ione, was actually the administration building for the Preston School of Industry, the first major attempt in California at rehabilitating, instead of just imprisoning, young offenders.&nbsp; Opened in 1894, the Preston School of Industry became a leader in the juvenile prison reform movement by giving convicted boys a real chance at life by educating them not only in academics, but in all of the useful trades of the time.&nbsp; Closed in 1960, when the Preston Youth Authority moved into a new administration building down the hill, the Preston Castle was left to deteriorate due to weather, vandalism, and general neglect.&nbsp; It now serves as a vacant, but vitally important landmark for Ione, Amador County, and the Motherlode.&nbsp; It is a California State Historic Landmark and is on the National Register of Historic Places.
Also available is a Virtual Tour for our mobility-restricted guests which will take place on the accessible ground floor (basement) of the Castle.
Guided tours - $15, age 12 and under $12
Virtual tours - $10, 12 and under $5
All tours for under 5 years, free
&nbsp;
Preston Castle
900 Palm Dr.&nbsp;(end of)
Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
(209)256-3623
info@prestoncastle.com
www.prestoncastle.com
&nbsp;

1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA

item.Name: Amador Farmers Market – Jackson
Kennedy Mine Tours
Preston Castle Historical Tours
item.Body:
&nbsp;Tours
Saturdays&nbsp; April 1st, 2017 thru&nbsp; August , 2017&nbsp; Except July 29th August 5th and 26th 2017
10am to 1pm
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
Come to Ione and enjoy an informative historical tour of the magnificent Preston Castle and surrounding grounds.&nbsp; The strikingly beautiful Romanesque style Preston Castle, on a hill in Ione, was actually the administration building for the Preston School of Industry, the first major attempt in California at rehabilitating, instead of just imprisoning, young offenders.&nbsp; Opened in 1894, the Preston School of Industry became a leader in the juvenile prison reform movement by giving convicted boys a real chance at life by educating them not only in academics, but in all of the useful trades of the time.&nbsp; Closed in 1960, when the Preston Youth Authority moved into a new administration building down the hill, the Preston Castle was left to deteriorate due to weather, vandalism, and general neglect.&nbsp; It now serves as a vacant, but vitally important landmark for Ione, Amador County, and the Mother lode.&nbsp; It is a California State Historic Landmark and is on the National Register of Historic Places.
Also available is a Virtual Tour for our mobility-restricted guests which will take place on the accessible ground floor (basement) of the Castle.
Guided tours - $15, age 12 and under $12
Self-Guided and Virtual tours - $10, 12 and under $5
All tours for under 5 years, free
&nbsp;
Preston Castle
900 Palm Dr.&nbsp;(end of)
Ione, CA &nbsp;95640
(209)256-3623
info@prestoncastle.com
www.prestoncastle.com
&nbsp;
