1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.

8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.

item.Name: Preston Castle Wine Tasting and Tour
item.Body:
Saturday
August 5th
5:00pm-8:00pm
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
Taste the fine wines of Amador County and experience the history of the majestic Preston Castle. Attendees will sample fine wines, poured by 15 different wineries, from commemorative Preston Castle wine glasses.
Sip a glass of wine, enjoy a variety of gourmet hors d&#39;oeuvres, and listen to live music on the patio where the food will be served, and in the basement of the Castle where the wineries will be pouring.
Last year&rsquo;s wineries included:&nbsp; Bella Grace, Bray, Clos du Lac, Drytown, Karmere, Nine Gables, Sera Fina, Sobon, Story, Tanis, Terra d&rsquo;Oro, TKC, Turley, Vino Noceto, and Wine Tree Farm.
This is our 13th annual Wine Tasting and Tour.&nbsp; It continues to be one of Amador County&#39;s premier wine events, and is always a sellout, so get your tickets now! Tickets: $40. Tickets are available at Clark&rsquo;s Corner, or online at www.prestoncastle.com.&nbsp; Call 209-256-3623 for more information and/or tickets.
&nbsp;
Preston Castle
900 Palm Drive
Ione, CA&nbsp; 95640
&nbsp;

item.Name: Kennedy Mine Tours
Barbera Festival
Oktoberfest of the Gold Country
item.Body:
3rd Saturday in September
1:00PM-8:00PM
&nbsp;
Willkommen in the Gold Country! Dust off your dirndl and lederhosen and come join the fun at the Jackson Oktoberfest on the third&nbsp;Saturday of September. Oktoberfest promises fun for the entire family, including live entertainment, contests, music and dancing, and an authentic taste of Bavaria with Wolfgang&#39;s soft pretzels, and of course, the mainstay of any Oktoberfest...German beer!
Jackson Oktoberfest was founded by Wolfgang&#39;s Pretzels of Pioneer, California in 2012. Wolfgang wanted to share his German heritage with the community, while raising some money for local charities. The event will be held at the Italian Picnic Grounds in Sutter Creek, which has been aptly dubbed &quot;Oktoberfest Picnic Grounds&quot; for the day, so there&#39;s plenty of room for everyone!
Beer aficionados will experience the taste of authentic German Oktoberfest beer without going across the pond. Delight in the flavors of Original Hofbrau Oktoberfest brew, along with several other Hofbrau beer selections. Wine, soft drinks and water will also be available.
Adding to the fun, will be a showcase of authentic oompah, polka, and waltzing music, and Bavarian Country &amp; Folklore dances. So put on your dancing shoes and brush up on your &ldquo;Chicken Dance&rdquo;!
Of course the best of any Oktoberfest celebration is the hearty menu of delicious German foods. Menu items include Bratwurst &amp; Sauerkraut, smoked pork chops &amp; Sauerkraut, Wolfgang&#39;s authentic Bavarian Soft Pretzels, apple strudel, and vanilla battered apple rings!
Adding to the excitement are traditional contests with plenty of prizes. Try your hand at Keg Rolling, Yodeling, Bratwurst Throwing, or see how many mugs you can hold in one hand!
To add to the fun, everyone is encouraged to dress in traditional German attire, however costume is not required. All are welcome&hellip;costume or not!
Pre-sale tickets are just $25 for a custom collector&#39;s beer glass or wine glass with one drink, and entertainment.
Youth ages 6 &ndash; 20 are $12 including a soda and entertainment. Children under 6 are free.
VIP Dinner packages are available for $38 and include reserved seating, a custom collector&#39;s beer glass or wine glass with one drink, your choice of pork chop or two bratwurst, sauerkraut and/or red cabbage &amp; pretzel dinner, and entertainment. A VIP table of 8 is just $280.
Jackson Oktoberfest is hosted by Wolfgang&rsquo;s Bavarian Pretzels. It is a for profit event with a portion of the proceeds to benefit local charities.
&nbsp;
Italian Picnic Grounds
Highway 49, Sutter Creek
(209)295-4664
www.jacksonoktoberfest.com
Wolfgang@volcano.net
&nbsp;

item.Name: Chaw&#039;se Big Time Indian Celebration
item.Body:
Saturday-Sunday
4th&nbsp;Weekend
September
&nbsp;
Chaw&#39;se Indian Grinding Rock State Historic Park in Pine Grove is home to the&nbsp;The Chaw&#39;se Regional Indian Museum.
&nbsp;
Big Time&nbsp;brings together Indian families&nbsp;on the weekend following the fourth Friday in September for the annual acorn gathering.
&nbsp;
Dancing, hand games, singing and storytelling are traditional at this event.&nbsp;Spectators are welcome, but there is no fixed schedule of events.&nbsp;Native American crafts and foods are available.&nbsp; During this event please ask for permission before taking photographs of Native Americans.
&nbsp;
THE ROUNDHOUSE (HUN&rsquo;GE)
For the Northern Sierra Miwok who settled in this area centuries ago, the Roundhouse (or Hun&rsquo;ge) was the true center of ceremonial and social life.
In 2013 the Jackson Rancheria Band of Miwuk Indians, along with neighboring Miwok tribes, began the once-in-a-generation rebuilding the Ceremonial Roundhouse (or Hun&rsquo;ge) at Chaw&rsquo;se Indian Grinding Rock State Historic Park.
The sacred process and traditions of deconstruction and rebuilding utilized traditional materials and construction techniques, and was completed in September of 2015.&nbsp; Every element of the Hun&rsquo;ges architecture contains spiritual significance, and the Roundhouse continues to be used by today&rsquo;s local tribes for private ceremonies.
&nbsp;
ROUNDHOUSE ETIQUETTE
Big Time is one of two annual events when the public is allowed access to the Roundhouse; the other is Chaw&rsquo;se Days which takes place each Memorial Day weekend. &nbsp;Please observe the following guidelines:
Enter in between dances. Do not leave until after a dance is completed. No photographs in the Roundhouse. Ask for permission before taking photographs of Native Americans.
Indian Grinding Rock SHP
14881 Pine Grove-Volcano Road
Pine Grove, CA &nbsp;95665
209-296-7488
&nbsp;
Parks.ca.gov/IndianGrindingRockSHP
&nbsp;

item.Name: Fall Fun Days Festival at Amador Flower Farm
Kennedy Mine Tours
Sierra Gold Harvest Quilt Show
item.Body:
Saturday &amp; Sunday
October 7th and 8th, 2017
Sat. 10:00AM-5:00PM
Sun. 10:00AM to 4:00PM
&nbsp;
October Since the first Sierra Gold Harvest Quilt Show in 1983, the show has grown in both size and popularity, taking up two buildings at the Amador County Fairgrounds.
The quilt show is a major fundraiser for the Sierra Gold Quilter&#39;s Guild and the proceeds are used to contribute quilts and other items to those in need in the community.
As part of the quilt show, members have created a stunning opportunity quilt won by a lucky raffle ticket holder.&nbsp;Win a beautful quilt! Raffle Tickets $1 for one and $5 for six. In addition, there will be a display of the many beautiful quilts created by guild members, vendors, a Country Store with many bargains, a small quilt auction, terrific food, and more.
&nbsp;
As the quilt show falls on the same weekend as the Amador County Big Crush, visitors to the Gold Country can enjoy a fabulous weekend of wine tasting and quilt appreciation! &nbsp;
Entry is $7.00; spouse and children under 12 are free.
&nbsp;
Amador County Fairgrounds
18621 Sherwood Street
Plymouth, CA&nbsp; 95669
(831)247-1907
email beachbreak112@aol.com.
SierraGoldQuiltersGuild.org/HarvestQuiltShow

item.Body:

&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;

item.Name: Great Sutter Creek Chili Cook-off and Car Show
item.Body:
Annually, 2nd Sunday of October
9am-4pm
&nbsp;
The annual Great Sutter Creek Chili Cook-Off and Car Show is a classic small town event.
&nbsp;
Almost 100 classic cars and hot rods fill one end of town and chili teams fill the opposite end. Music fills the air, as people sample the homemade chili and salsa at each booth and then vote for their favorite. This event is FUN and FAMILY FRIENDLY!
&nbsp;
The Car Show is free to wander and admire and is open from 9am to 4pm. Chili tasting is from 11am - 3pm. Chili Tasting is a $6.00 entry and $4.00 for children. Includes wristband for unlimited tasting (or until the chili runs out) cup, spoon, napkin and ballot.
Here are a few highlights of the day we don&rsquo;t want you to miss:
Burrito-Bar Breakfast &ndash; Our local Boy Scout Troupe 63 will be offering breakfast from 7:00am &ndash; 9:30am for all of you who came hungry, build your own delicious breakfast burrito.&nbsp; Located in the Auditorium on the South end of town. Yum! Chili Tasting (Of Course) &ndash; On the North end of town Chili tasting from 11:00 &ndash; 3:00.&nbsp; Come bid on your favorite team! Chili awards will be announced at 3:00 Beer Garden &ndash; Located on the corner of Keyes Street and Main Street. Great selection of beer and Micro-brews. Hot Dog Cart &ndash; Still hungry after chili tasting?&nbsp; Check out our hotdog cart offering delicious jumbo dogs with all the fixin&rsquo;s. Raffle &ndash; The raffle booth is chock-full of great items and is located in the middle of town at the flag pole.&nbsp; Please have fun participating and help support the restoration of our Historic Sutter Creek Elementary School.&nbsp; Raffle prizes will be announced at 11:30 &amp; 1:00. Shopping - With all the excitement in the street, don&rsquo;t miss out on visiting all of our fine shops, wine tasting rooms, and restaurants.&nbsp; They will be open long after our event is over.
To enter click to download form:&nbsp; Annual Great Sutter Creek Chili Cook-Off &amp; Car Show.
To&nbsp;be a vendor, please download the APPLICATION and mail to SCBPA, P.O. Box 600 Sutter Creek, Ca 95685.
&nbsp;
Main St.
Sutter Creek, CA
209-267-1344
email:&nbsp; info@suttercreek.org
http://www.suttercreek.org/sutter-creek-events-chili-cookoff-car-show.html

item.Name: Amador Farmers Market – Jackson
Kennedy Mine Tours
Sierra Gold Harvest Quilt Show
item.Body:
Saturday &amp; Sunday
October 7th and 8th, 2017
Sat. 10:00AM-5:00PM
Sun. 10:00AM to 4:00PM
&nbsp;
October Since the first Sierra Gold Harvest Quilt Show in 1983, the show has grown in both size and popularity, taking up two buildings at the Amador County Fairgrounds.
The quilt show is a major fundraiser for the Sierra Gold Quilter&#39;s Guild and the proceeds are used to contribute quilts and other items to those in need in the community.
As part of the quilt show, members have created a stunning opportunity quilt won by a lucky raffle ticket holder.&nbsp;Win a beautful quilt! Raffle Tickets $1 for one and $5 for six. In addition, there will be a display of the many beautiful quilts created by guild members, vendors, a Country Store with many bargains, a small quilt auction, terrific food, and more.
&nbsp;
As the quilt show falls on the same weekend as the Amador County Big Crush, visitors to the Gold Country can enjoy a fabulous weekend of wine tasting and quilt appreciation! &nbsp;
Entry is $7.00; spouse and children under 12 are free.
&nbsp;
Amador County Fairgrounds
18621 Sherwood Street
Plymouth, CA&nbsp; 95669
(831)247-1907
email beachbreak112@aol.com.

item.Body:

8:00am-Noon
&nbsp;
Annual 5 K Run/Walk begins at Sutter Amador Hospital, Huberty Way, Jackson,&nbsp;and will wind&nbsp;its way through some of Jackson&rsquo;s most historic neighborhoods. Last year&rsquo;s event was an enormous success - with over 175 walker/runners.
Check In: Race Day at 8:00 am
Race Start: 9:00 am
Kid&rsquo;s Fun Run: 8:30 am
5 K Entry Fee: $30 includes T-shirt
Should you choose to sign up after October 1, 2016 we cannot guarantee a T-Shirt.
Kid&rsquo;s Fun run is $5 or FREE with a non-perishable food donation (no T-shirt)
Registration: Please fill out a registration form and send to or drop off at: Bodies-N-Balance ,12180 Industrial Blvd., Suite 51, Jackson, CA 95642&nbsp; (Amador Ridge Plaza&mdash;By Safeway) Checks payable to FACT. We will accept registration forms on race day&hellip; Just can&rsquo;t guarantee a T-shirt.
Denise Schaad (209)256-1829
Colleen Begovich at (209) 223-1618.
www.amadorfact.org
The Interfaith Food Bank will be accepting food donations at the race.
FACT&rsquo;s singular mission is to close the annual funding gap and to help correct this year&rsquo;s budget deficit by organizing and implementing community fundraising events which directly benefit the Food Bank.

item.Name: Clarks Corner Cycling Challenge
item.Body:
Annually
2nd Saturday
of October
10/08/2016
&nbsp;
Founded in 2010, the &ldquo;Clark&rsquo;s Corner Cycling Challenge,&rdquo; (CCCC) is an annual cycling event/group ride held annually, starting in beautiful Ione, CA, and circling through Amador County.
&nbsp;
The Clark&#39;s Corner Cycling Challenge was designed as a way to give to charitable causes, promote business in the City of Ione and County of Amador, encourage community wellness, and share the amazing cycling we have around Ione.
&nbsp;
Quote from Chris Horner: &ldquo;I love riding in the &lsquo;Clark&rsquo;s Corner Cycling Challenge,&rsquo; and am happy to be back with the cyclists in Northern California. After the big win a few weeks ago at the &lsquo;Tour of Spain,&rsquo; I was excited to be returning for a fun ride in Amador County, because Northern California has a very loyal and enthusiastic cycling community. It was great! I&rsquo;m really glad I could make it&rdquo; - October 2013
&nbsp;

item.Name: Amador Farmers Market – Pine Grove
1st Saturday Amador Art Trek
item.Body:
1st Saturday
of the Month
11:00-6:00 pm
&nbsp;
Take the 1st Saturday Amador Art Trek and experience colorful art of all styles, sizes and price ranges. Free and easy parking makes it all worthwhile plus there are complimentary refreshments offered at some of the 12 galleries. Going on the Art Trek is a time to have fun seeing what participating galleries are currently exhibiting. It&#39;s a great way to tour Amador County.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts.org/ArtTrek
&nbsp;
A free, handy tri-fold brochure has been created to guide visitors to various locations to experience the vibrant local art scene. Pick up one at the first gallery you visit, or you can find one on-line at Participating ArtTrek Locations and MAP.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
These are the participating Art Trek galleries on 1st Saturday:
&nbsp;
Acme Art
8359 Center Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA 95245
209-286-8040
www.acmeartmokehill.com/home/
info@acmeartmokehil.com
Community based art and craft workshops.
&nbsp;
Add Art
20 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Mon.-Fri. 10:30-5; Sat. 10:30-4
209-223-3339
www.addart.com
Fine art framing services and the colorful work of the late John Johannsen are featured. This internationally known artist first showcased his vibrant whimsical canvases in a one-man show at the California Palace of the Legion of Honor in San Fancisco.
&nbsp;
AmadorArts Gallery
11A Randolph Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 12-4, weekday hours vary (call ahead)
209-267-9038
www.amadorarts.org
&nbsp;
Chaos Glassworks Art Glass Gallery and Hotshop
121A Hanford Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Wed.- Fri.11-5 (ofen open earlier), Sat. 10-7, Sun., 10-6, Mon. and Tues. by appt.
209-267-9317
www.chaosglassworks.com
Just north of downtown Sutter Creek on old Hwy 49. David and Heather Hopman make a wide variety of art glass items including vases, bowls, pumpkins, lighting, sculpture, beads, paperweights, jewelry and other blown and lampworked pieces. Live glassblowing demonstrations happen all day on weekends.
&nbsp;
Charles Spinetta Winery &amp; Wildlife Art Gallery
12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA
Thurs.-Sat. 11:30-5:30; Sun. 11:30-4
209-286-1387
www.gallerypetroglyphe.com
Petroglyphe Gallery features original contemporary works of art in oil, acrylic, watercolor, glass, ceramic and jewelry.&nbsp; Also on display, are limited edition bronze sculptures and copper plate etching prints.
The gallery represents North American artists, many from California, who have impressive credentials with works in private, corporate, and public collections.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Gallery
35 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Mon., Wed.,Thurs., Sun., 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat. 10-6
209-267-0228
www.suttercreekgallery.com
An Amador artist coop,our artists produce many works of art that are reflective of Amador County and its beautiful Gold Country. Look for Gold Rush themes in historic buildings and mining ruins, landscapes, vineyards, flora, and fauna.
&nbsp;
Volcano Gallery
16105 Main Street,Volcano, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 10ish-5ish
209-296-3334
www.benkergallery.com
An eclectic mix of contemporary local art. Featuring paintings, ceramic sculpture and pottery by Bob Benker; ceramics by Marilyn Baldwin; jewelry and leather goods by Ellen Record; misc. jewelry, &nbsp;gourds &amp; fun stuff by Delores Weaverling; &nbsp;weaving by Gretchen Johnson &amp; rotating local artists featured monthly.
&nbsp;

AmadorArts Winefest
item.Body:
Annually, 2nd Saturday in November
4:00-9:00pm
November 11, 2017
The annual Winefest in Sutter Creek is a popular walk-about wine-tasting event. Stroll historic Main Street while tasting a huge selection of Amador County wines in Sutter Creek&rsquo;s shops. Follow the adage &ldquo;Save Water, Drink Wine,&rdquo; and you&rsquo;ll be helping to bring the arts to local schools.
Guests may check-in to pick up their wine glass, wristband and tasting map at the Sutter Creek Auditorium starting at 4:00 pm. Take a look at the huge silent auctions, one for Art, for Wine, and a Table for Premier Gifts and Travel Packages.&nbsp; Start bidding while sampling Amador Olive Oils. Then from 4:30 to 7:00 pm, walk up and down the three blocks of historic Main Street visiting over 20 shops where each one will be offering tastings of a different fine Amador County winery.&nbsp; Just remember: the law states that no wine can be in your glass when you&rsquo;re outside the shops.
At 7:00 pm, return to the Auditorium for the Winefest festive Grand Finale, which will feature live music, desserts, more wine and our HUGE silent auction including Wine, Art and Gifts. The Winefest event ends at 9:00 pm.
Advance tickets are $30 each, or $35 the day of the event at the auditorium starting at 4:00 pm. By purchasing you ticket right here, your printed PayPal receipt will be your ticket to save time at the auditorium&rsquo;s check-in.&nbsp; These local locations have tickets to sell: Amador Council of Tourism Office in Sutter Hill; Le Mulet Rouge in Sutter Creek; Amador Chamber of Commerce, Main St., Jackson. Dr.Curry&rsquo;s Dental Office in Plymouth, and Up Country Hardware in Pine Grove.
Sales of tickets are limited this year, so now&rsquo;s the time to contact your friends, book your dinner or lodging reservations, possibly a limo, and generally prepare for this greatest fundraiser of the year for AmadorArts. Proceeds of the Winefest provide much-needed funds for arts in education in local schools and in the community.
Winefest
Main Street
Sutter Creek, CA
http://www.amadorarts.org/arts-news/winefest/
&nbsp;
Amador County Arts Council 11-A Randolph Street (Monteverde Store Museum annex) P.O. Box 206 Sutter Creek, CA&nbsp; 95685
amadorarts@gmail.com
209-267-9038

12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, CA
Mon, Thurs., Fri. 8-4; Sat. &amp; Sun. 10-4:30
209-245-3384
charlesspinettawinery.com
The&nbsp;tasting room includes one of Northern California&#39;s largest wildlife art galleries with original watercolors, sculpture, pottery, and hundreds of framed prints. The distinctive Spinetti Wine label paintings by Joe Garcia are not to be missed.&nbsp; Sip wine while you gaze at this amazing collection.
&nbsp;
Fine Eye Gallery
71 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Every day 10:30-5:30
209-267-0571
www.fineeye.com&nbsp;
From sophisticated and stylish to quirky and whimsical, quality works from talented makers are gathered for your enjoyment.
&nbsp;
Full Circle Trading Co.
15 Main St, Jackson,&nbsp; CA
(209)-223-1214
Many art &amp; craft supplies.cultural gifts, and home decor.
&nbsp;
Gallery 10
15 Eureka Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Thurs.-Mon. 11-4 (winter), 11-5 (summer)
209-267-0203
http://gallery10suttercreek.com/index.html
Gallery 10 specializes in a variety of artistic mediums including original wall art (pastels, watercolors, oils, acrylics mixed medium and pencil drawings), welded aluminum, woodwork, jewelry, ceramics, cards, hand blown glass and sculpture. While spotlighting original art, prints and giclees are also available. In a recent survey, local residents voted Gallery 10 as the best art gallery in Amador County. Gallery 10 is member-owned and also features consignment artists representing a variety of mediums.
&nbsp;
Gallery M
Corner of Shenandoah Rd (E16) &amp; Holly Lane
River Pines, CA
Thurs.-Sun. 10-5 (winter hours vary please call ahead)
209-256-9561
http://www.wild-m-art-and-forge.com/
Objects of art from steel and copper and handmade jewelry.
&nbsp;
Gifted
8 Main Street, Jackson, CA
Tues.-Thurs. 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat.10-6; Sun. 11-4
209-223-1558
www.shopgifted.net
Gifted is a one-of-a-kind gift shop and studio that exclusively carries American manufactured and locally made gifts and goods.Here we value originality, sincerity and glitter. Look for Gifted on the ground floor of the majestic three story Odd Fellows building, Historic&nbsp;Jackson Main Street.
&nbsp;
Little City Studio &amp; Gallery
14180 Main StreetAmador City
Fri., Sat., Sun. 10-5
209-267-9189
Working textile studio &amp; gallery. Weaving, knitting, fabric collage and quilts. Art, jewelry, hand-knit wearables, gifts -featuring local atists and craftspeople. Rugs &amp; scarves to order. Also, new and gently worn clothing. We carry beautiful handmade things at very reasonable prices. Functional stoneware pieces from the collection of Joyce Theurkauf, long-time Amador City resident and potter.
&nbsp;
Petroglyphe Gallery
8317 Main Street, Mokelumne Hill, CA
Thurs.-Sat. 11:30-5:30; Sun. 11:30-4
209-286-1387
www.gallerypetroglyphe.com
Petroglyphe Gallery features original contemporary works of art in oil, acrylic, watercolor, glass, ceramic and jewelry.&nbsp; Also on display, are limited edition bronze sculptures and copper plate etching prints.
The gallery represents North American artists, many from California, who have impressive credentials with works in private, corporate, and public collections.
&nbsp;
Sutter Creek Gallery
35 Main Street, Sutter Creek, CA
Mon., Wed.,Thurs., Sun., 10-5; Fri. &amp; Sat. 10-6
209-267-0228
www.suttercreekgallery.com
An Amador artist coop,our artists produce many works of art that are reflective of Amador County and its beautiful Gold Country. Look for Gold Rush themes in historic buildings and mining ruins, landscapes, vineyards, flora, and fauna.
&nbsp;
Volcano Gallery
16105 Main Street,Volcano, CA
Sat. &amp; Sun. 10ish-5ish
209-296-3334
www.benkergallery.com
An eclectic mix of contemporary local art. Featuring paintings, ceramic sculpture and pottery by Bob Benker; ceramics by Marilyn Baldwin; jewelry and leather goods by Ellen Record; misc. jewelry, &nbsp;gourds &amp; fun stuff by Delores Weaverling; &nbsp;weaving by Gretchen Johnson &amp; rotating local artists featured monthly.

Tree of Lights
item.Body:
Annually, 1st Sunday in December
12/5/16 5:00pm
Come celebrate the joy of remembrance. Hospice of Amador &amp; Calaveras invites you and your family to celebrate the life of someone you love and provides the opportunity to stand with others and honor the memory of your loved ones who have gone before us. These one-hour celebrations
For each $10 donation Hospice will place a light on the Tree of Lights and list the name of the person(s) you wish to remember on a memorial board at the site.

Tree lighting festivities begin at 5:00 pm and include music, a celebration candle lighting, lighting of the tree, and refreshments.

item.Name: Olde Tyme Christmas at Preston Castle
item.Body:
2nd Saturday of December
Saturday 12/10, 10am-4pm
&nbsp;
Travel back to olden times at the beautiful Preston Castle, from 10 am to 4 pm, and find holiday decorations and vendors with lots of interesting arts, crafts, jewelry, baked goods, and other gift items.&nbsp; This is a great place to take care of much of your holiday gift list. Most of the vendors will be indoors in the basement area of the Castle.
Santa will be available for your wish lists and photos, starting at Noon.
You may take a self-guided tour of the historic Preston Castle, 10 am to 2 pm, $10.
&nbsp;
On Saturday night, you can view the outside of the Castle lit up in Holiday Lights, from 5 pm to 7 pm.
&nbsp;
Preston Castle
900 (end of) Palm Drive
Ione, CA&nbsp; 95640

Celebrate the holiday season on Shenandoah School Road for the annual Holiday Cookie Run!

Stop at the Amador Flower Farm from to visit Santa and enjoy cookies and hot cider, and then travel down the road to Cooper Vineyards and Terra d&rsquo;Oro for a taste of your favorite dessert wines paired with sweet or savory cookies.

Holiday spirit and beautiful decorations will abound at each location, so bring your sweet tooth and seasonal cheer to join us in celebrating our favorite time of the year!

item.Body:
Santa will be at the Flower Farm on Sunday, December 11th from 11-3.
Also that day the farm and the wineries on our road have a holiday open house (Shenandoah School Road Holiday Open House) and are serving cookies, doing wine pairings etc.
Santa only visits once a year so don&#39;t miss him!&nbsp; Our gift shop is all dolled up for the holidays. We have ornaments, gifts and decorations for your home. Santa is here to see the kids, too!

item.Name: Sourdough Slim
item.Body:
Annually in December
Saturday 12/17/16
8:00PM
&nbsp;
Hold on to your seats and get ready for a rollicking evening of outrageous humor and song.
Sutter Creek Theater presents its annual Christmas extravaganza featuring popular Gold Country old time music makers, Sourdough Slim &amp; The Saddle Pals, Faux Renwah, and Robert Armstrong. A once-a-year opportunity to catch all these artists in a show together. Thrill to the mind-boggling yodeling of the infamous Sourdough Slim. Delight in the harmonious Western melodies of The Saddle Pals. Catch the wise-cracking Cactus Bob and lovely bass-thumping Prairie Flower as they revel in Old Time Music nirvana with their Faux Renwah band. Be amazed by the world champion musical saw and string instrument wizardry of Robert Armstrong. Yes folks, all this and more will be yours when you join us for this fun filled, year end spectacular. Sourdough&#39;s traditional last show of the year is always entertaining and usually sells out. DON&#39;T MISS THE FUN! &nbsp;
Sutter Creek Theatre 44 Main St.
Sutter Creek CA P.O. Box 29 Sacramento CA 95812 (916) 425-0077 info@suttercreektheatre.com
www.suttercreektheatre.com
Tickets also available at
Heart &amp; Soul (next door to the theatre)
42 Main St.
Sutter Creek CA &nbsp;
11-5 pm everyday (209) 256-9702
&nbsp;

Come OUT to Amador- New dates in March 2017
item.Body:
Come OUT to Amador... the county&#39;s first food and wine weekend for the LGBT community taking place January 20-22, 2017. New dates are March 24-26, 2017. Same great event with spring dates! Come OUT to Amador is an LGBT weekend of curated food, wine and fun experiences in the Sierra Nevada foothills. Participants will experience intimate sessions with renowned wine makers, grape growers, acclaimed chefs, farmers and so much more, all with the backdrop of beautiful Amador County.&nbsp;
Tickets include:
- Friday evening reception/light tapas style dinner with wine pairings
- Friday evening interactive entertainment experience, with wine, of course
- Either an all day excursion or two smaller intimate experiences focused around food, wine, the outdoors and history. All experiences include specially crafted catered lunches, afternoon snacks, and... wine!
- Beer vs Wine Dinner on Saturday night, catered by James Beard recognized Restaurant Taste
- Light brunch on Sunday
- Sunday afternoon activities on your own
- Transportation to/from all events and experiences from host hotels (park your car on Friday evening and don&#39;t touch it again until Sunday afternoon).
- All host hotels include breakfast on Saturday and Sunday for Come OUT guests.&nbsp;
All information and ticket purchases can be found at Come Out to Amador Tickets and questions can be sent to comeouttoamador@gmail.com.
&nbsp;

Holistic Health &amp; Wellness Fair
item.Body:
Annually
Last Satuday
January
11:00am-4:00pm
&nbsp;
Experience natural approaches to health, by meeting with practitioners who specialize in a wide array of complementary health and wellness disciplines.
&nbsp;
In addition to holistic health and wellness practitioners and products, Amador County Holistic Health and Wellness Fair is also committed to educating the community on green lifestyle choices such as eating locally, converting to solar and recycling.
&nbsp;
Information booths, massages, lectures and product sales, highlight the many choices we have available in our community to take responsibility for our health care choices, to live life joyfully and with care for our community and world.
&nbsp;
Jackson Senior Center
229 New York Ranch Road
Jackson, CA&nbsp; 95642
209-419-2503
